item.title: Celtic adjourn AGM amid 'sack the board' chants by shareholders
item.description: Chairman Peter Lawwell adjourns Celtic's annual meeting inside five minutes following chants of "sack the board" by some shareholders.

item.title: Palmer fractures toe by stubbing it on door
item.description: Chelsea's Cole Palmer will be out for another week as he fractures his toe by stubbing it on a door at night.

item.title: We miss the player and the person - Slot on Jota
item.description: In the wake of Andy Robertson's emotional tribute to Diogo Jota, Liverpool boss Arne Slot says his side miss their former player on both a personal and professional level.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v singer Olly Murs
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer Olly Murs - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Pogba closes on first appearance since doping ban
item.description: Paul Pogba is set to make his long-awaited return from a doping ban for Monaco this weekend.

item.title: Man Utd progress in Champions League - what do Arsenal and Chelsea need?
item.description: BBC Sport assesses how Arsenal, Chelsea and Man Utd have fared so far in this season's Women's Champions League with two league phase rounds remaining.

item.title: Five things to look out for in EFL: Steel City struggle & Norwich's new era
item.description: Here are five things you should look out for across the English Football League this weekend.

item.title: 'Best display of season' but Chelsea rue missed opportunity
item.description: Having suffered plenty of past heartache at Barcelona's expense, Chelsea may have ordinarily celebrated a 1-1 Women's Champions League draw - but this was a missed opportunity.

item.title: Wales host Bosnia and Northern Ireland visit Italy in play-offs
item.description: Wales will host Bosnia-Herzegovina and Northern Ireland travel to Italy in the World Cup play-off semi-finals.

item.title: Paramount to show Champions League games in UK from 2027
item.description: Champions League matches in the UK will be shown by Paramount from 2027 after the US company wins the broadcast rights for the tournament.

item.title: Stoke boss Robins signs new contract
item.description: Mark Robins signs a new three-and-a-half-year contract as manager of Stoke City.

item.title: Some people 'not ready for black superstar' like Bellingham - Wright
item.description: Former England striker Ian Wright does not think some people are "ready for a black superstar" following the media treatment of Jude Bellingham.

item.title: Man Utd, Liverpool & Newcastle eye Anderson - Friday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United in race with Liverpool and Newcastle for Elliot Anderson, Arsenal explore deal for Scott McTominay, Crystal Palace reignite interest in Ousmane Diomande, plus more.

item.title: Under-fire Ross County face Queen's Park in Championship - live on BBC
item.description: Queen's Park and Ross County find themselves at the wrong end of the Scottish Championship going into Friday's BBC Scotland game.

item.title: Home draw 'key for Wales' - reaction to World Cup play-offs
item.description: Wales' football pundits react to the World Cup play-off draw which sees Craig Bellamy's side take on Bosnia-Herzegovina in a home semi-final in March.

item.title: How does Arsenal defence compare to Premier League's best?
item.description: Where do Arsenal's back four rank in terms of the best ever in the Premier League?

item.title: Chelsea rue missed chances in draw with Barcelona
item.description: Chelsea draw with European giants Barcelona in a pulsating encounter at Stamford Bridge as both sides maintain their unbeaten records in the Champions League league phase.

item.title: Grief, love & the Gunners - inside the iconic Arsenal supporters' club
item.description: BBC Sport goes behind the scenes of the independent Arsenal supporters' club to find a story of grief, love and community in the heart of north London.

item.title: Bronze reacts to 'frustrating' Champions League draw
item.description: Chelsea's defender Lucy Bronze speaks about frustrating second-half against her former club Barcelona as they draw 1-1 in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: 'Wicked strike' from Pajor to bring Barcelona level
item.description: Ewa Pajor scores an "emphatic" equaliser for Barcelona in their Champions League match against Chelsea.

item.title: 'World-class' Carpenter goal puts Chelsea ahead against Barcelona
item.description: Chelsea's Ellie Carpenter scores a stunning opener against FC Barcelona in the Women's Champions League.

item.title: BBC signs 'saviour of grassroots football' Bracknall
item.description: Match of the Day presenter Gabby Logan gets a surprise visit from Sunday pub league manager Steve Bracknall.

item.title: Plans for Birmingham City's 62,000-seater stadium revealed
item.description: Club chairman Tom Wagner reveals the design for his club's new 62,000-capacity stadium in Bordesley Green.

item.title: Play-off pressure 'very much on Italy' - O'Neill
item.description: With Northern Ireland potentially two wins away from qualification for the 2026 World Cup, manager Michael O'Neill is urging his players not to "waste this opportunity".

item.title: NI manager Oxtoby in talks over Newcastle job
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Tanya Oxtoby is in advanced talks to become head coach at WSL 2 side Newcastle United.

item.title: Clarke touted as 'Sir' after 'best night in Scottish football history'
item.description: Scotland's win over Denmark is described as the "best night in Scottish football history" as SFA chief executive Ian Maxwell says talk of a new contract for head coach Steve Clarke is "a conversation for another day".

item.title: Panel split over disallowed Liverpool goal at Man City
item.description: The Premier League's KMI Panel votes 3-2 both that Liverpool's goal should have stood on-field, but didn't reach the VAR threshold.

item.title: Are you not being entertained? The decline of the open-play goal
item.description: Open-play goals have been on the decline this season and BBC Sport takes a closer look at the trend.

item.title: Happiest I've been in football - ex-Premier League boss Brown on life in non-league
item.description: Veteran manager Phil Brown hopes his current job with Peterborough Sports could pave the way for a return to the English Football League.

item.title: Make Haaland captain all season? The FPL talking point
item.description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland is in sensational form. So do you captain him every week in your fantasy football team? Our FPL experts give their views.

item.title: Webb denies WSL official lost role over complaint
item.description: Referees' chief Howard Webb denies a former staff member lost her position as an international football referee because she complained a coach "manhandled" her.

item.title: Need, need, got: EFL launches Panini sticker album
item.description: The English Football League and Panini team up to launch a sticker collection featuring all 72 EFL clubs for the first time.

item.title: Wrexham will not make 'too many changes' in January
item.description: Wrexham manager Phil Parkinson says he does not want to "disrupt the group too much" during the January transfer window.

item.title: World Cup would be 'icing on cake' for Wales' Ramsey
item.description: Wales captain Aaron Ramsey says it would be "the icing on the cake" if the midfielder can overcome his injury problems and the side make next summer's World Cup.

item.title: What is Wales' record against Bosnia and Herzegovina?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Wales' historical record against Bosnia and Herzegovina

item.title: I was kicked off school team, now girls can play football - Smith
item.description: A target for 90% of schools in England to offer girls equal access to football in PE lessons is achieved three years ahead of schedule.

item.title: Non-league club bans 'micro' shin pads after 'unbearable' injury to forward
item.description: Non-league Ilfracombe Town ban 'micro' shin pads after forward Riley Malin suffered an "unbearable" double-leg break in a South West Peninsula League match at the weekend.

item.title: What has gone wrong at Plymouth Argyle?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at why Plymouth Argyle have fallen to the bottom of League One after 15 games this season.

item.title: What is Northern Ireland's record against Italy?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Northern Ireland's historical record against Italy

item.title: Captain Salah and leave out Haaland? FPL team of the week
item.description: With a tough away game at Newcastle for FPL top scorer Erling Haaland, gameweek 12 presents a chance to give the captain's armband to someone else - and that man is Mohamed Salah.

item.title: Who has qualified for World Cup and when is draw?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore when the World Cup draw is, how the seeding works and who has qualified so far.

item.title: The non-league striker proving a match for Haaland
item.description: A Merthyr Town striker is proving more than a match for Erling Haaland with his impressive goal-scoring form.

item.title: 'Scotland cash in almost 30 years of glorious failure as dreams come true'
item.description: A generation of Scotland fans witness the greatest game of their lives on an astonishing night at Hampden. Nick McPheat was among them.

item.title: Which Premier League teams will lose most players to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport has a look at which Premier League clubs will be most - and least - affected by the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: The key questions facing Tuchel before World Cup
item.description: England head coach Thomas Tuchel now faces key decisions in the countdown to the World Cup, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: Target Liverpool, go four at back - FPL tips to kick-start your season
item.description: What have we learned so far this FPL season? What's the best way to approach the game? Our four experts give you their best advice to get ahead of your rivals.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Why are Man Utd not playing on a Saturday for two months?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Manchester United are not playing on a Saturday for two months

item.title: Who is not going to the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at which countries and players will not be competing at the 2026 World Cup

item.title: What is Scotland's World Cup record?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at how Scotland have fared in previous World Cup competitions.

item.title: Why VAR gets involved in some penalties but not others
item.description: It was a weekend of VAR penalty decisions in the Premier League, with spot-kicks awarded, cancelled and ignored. BBC Sport explains why.

item.title: Why can Channel Islands players play for England?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why players born in the Channel Islands like Alex Scott can represent England at a senior level.

item.title: Why do footballers tape up their wrists?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explains why footballers use tape to wrap their wrists.

item.title: Scotland edge out Denmark in six-goal epic to reach World Cup
item.description: Watch the best of the action as Scotland beat Denmark 4-2 to reach the men's World Cup finals for the first time since 1998.

item.title: 'I couldn't get Jota out my head' - what Scotland's heroes said
item.description: Scotland's players talk, and talk, and talk after sealing a place in the men's World Cup for the first time since 1998 with a scarcely believable 4-2 victory over Denmark.

item.title: Was McTominay overhead kick not even Scotland's best goal of the night?
item.description: Scotland scored three stunning goals in their era-defining win over Denmark - but which was the best?

item.title: How has world changed since Scotland were last at men's finals?
item.description: When Scotland last reached a men's World Cup, the Scottish parliament didn't exist, Google wasn't a thing and a pint of lager was roughly Â£1.90.

item.title: 'I woke up this morning with no nerves' - Clarke hails Scotland players
item.description: Head coach Steve Clarke hails his Scotland players after they qualify for a first men's World Cup since 1998.

item.title: Mainz lose court appeal over El Ghazi wrongful dismissal
item.description: German club Mainz have lost a court appeal for wrongful dismissal by Dutch winger Anwar El Ghazi over social media posts regarding the Israel-Gaza conflict.

item.title: How content creator became scout in Serie A
item.description: How former content creator Felix Johnston became a first-team scout for Serie A club Como 1907.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
